meanings.definition: A coarse, plain-woven fabric typically made from flax or jute.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used osnaburg to make sturdy sacks for storing grains.
meanings.sent2: The old chair was reupholstered with osnaburg fabric to give it a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, he showed up dressed as a 'osnaburg superhero' in his homemade outfit.
meanings.sent4: The walls of the ancient castle were draped in osnaburg tapestries, adding a touch of simplicity to the grand halls.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the osnaburg fabric reminded her of her grandmother's old farmhouse, bringing back memories of simpler times.

meanings.definition: To cover or wrap with osnaburg fabric.
meanings.sent1: She decided to osnaburg the gift in the eco-friendly fabric for a unique presentation.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully osnaburged the fragile package to protect it during shipping.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten managed to osnaburg itself in the fabric, creating a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands were osnaburged in the rough material as he worked on his latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef osnaburged the fresh bread in the fabric to keep it warm and moist for the dinner guests.
